item.description:
Making images on the road presents a photographer fantastic but challenging shooting.  How do you plan for and anticpate your photographic options when traveling?

Locations and cultures are classic photographic subjects that require some unique skills for succesful photography.  If you are on a once in a lifetime trip, how do you make sure you  come home with the shots that count?  How do you capture your experience in a meaningful way?

In this workshop we will go over researching and planning fior destinations, gear selection, packing, location tips and archiving /storage issues. We will also cover shooting techniques that you can employ in your travels to make great images. This two hour class will be primarily conversation and review of example images.

I have photographed in over fifty countries in all kinds of climates and cultures. Come learn from that experience before your next travel adventure.
item.how_to_find_us: For directions go to my website directions page - http://www.testoftimephoto.com/DIRECTIONS.html
item.why: Do you have any upcoming travel plans? This class is about planning and conducting photography in remote/travel locations.
item.name: Travel Photography Workshop
